newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price--USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price--USDA.

text.p: USDA reported Wednesday that around 3,000 head were exported into the United States at four crossing points Tuesday.

Through Santa Teresa, N.M., around 1,600 steer calves were sold at prices 2 cents/lb higher than last week. "Trade moderate, demand moderate. Bulk of supply consisted of steers weighing 300-500 lb, the USDA said.
Prices for head weighing 300-400 lb were 90-100 cents/lb and for 400-500 lb head at 80-90 cents/lb.

Through Nogales, Ariz., around 1,000 head were sold at steady prices for steer calves, the USDA said. Prices were 86-96 cents/lb for head weighing 300-400 lb and for 400-500 ln head they were 78-86 cents/lb.

Through, Laredo, Texas, around 300 head were sold and through Del Rio, Texas, around 100 were sold. The USDA reported from both export points that not enough head was traded to establish trend prices.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom (525) 7289530. E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com))
